Coordinates: 17°45′06″N 83°20′08″E﻿ / ﻿17.751773°N 83.335586°E﻿ / 17.751773; 83.335586

Heritage center, cultural centre in Kailasagiri, Visakhapatnam
Telugu Saamskruthika Niketanam
Established 19 November 2015 (2015-11-19)
Location Kailasagiri, Visakhapatnam
Type Heritage center, cultural centre
Owner Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority,Government of Andhra Pradesh

Telugu Saamskruthika Niketanam is all so called as World Telugu Museum is located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh,India. it was established in the year of 2015 by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Objectives
  • 2 See also
  • 3 External links
  • 4 References

Objectives[edit]

The main objective of this museum is to elaborate Telugu history and culture from Satavahana dynasty to till now.the Telugu museum is showing 42 episodes of Telugu culture, arts,folk arts, great poets,language, literature and history of great personalities in Telugu society.[2]

See also[edit]

  • List of museums in India
